Last night, Moses Brown joined Anthony Davis, Joel Embiid, Nikola Jokic, and Myles Turner as the only players in the last 10 years to have a game with 20+ points, 15+ rebounds, and 5+ blocks in their second season.

OKC's starting lineup last night was Ty Jerome, Poku, Moses Brown, Justin Jackson, and SGA. Other players who got significant time were Theo Maledon, Kenrich Williams, Isaiah Roby, and Darius Miller. Did you know all of these players existed before this post?

[Wojnarowski] The Celtics are trading Kemba Walker, the No. 16 overall pick in the 2021 draft and a 2025 second-round draft pick to Oklahoma City for Al Horford, Moses Brown and a 2023 second-round pick, sources tell ESPN.

[Himmelsbach] Some things I'm hearing in the aftermath of the Kemba deal: -Cs feel better about their chances of re-signing Fournier now -This doesn't necessarily mean Tristan Thompson's time in Boston is over -Moses Brown was mostly added as a salary match but will get a look
Moses Brown is a underrated piece in this trade

Because TPEs are fun, Boston will create a new one in the trade with OKC. Assuming BOS brings Moses Brown in via the Jeff Teague $1.6M TPE, they'll have the following meaningful TPEs: $11.05M- Hayward (expires in Aug) $6.87M- Walker $5.0M- Theis $4.76M- Kanter (expires in Aug)

[MacMahon] Source confirms that the Mavs will receive 21-year-old center Moses Brown from Boston in the Josh Richardson trade. The 7-foot-2 Brown averaged 8.6 points and 8.9 rebounds for the Thunder last season.
